markdown:
Bul-gaes are manifestations of the eclipsed sun and moon. They resemble large canines, though their coloration and features change as they exercise their powers over heat and cold. Depending on whether they have most recently unleashed their lunar or solar powers, a bul-gae resembles either a crimson hound wreathed in flames or a cerulean, frostbitten fox, respectively. Legends say that the first bul-gae attempted to steal the sun from the sky. As they bit down on the burning sphere, though, the bul-gae was badly burned. Having failed, they then tried to retrieve the moon, but when they touched the moon the bul-gae froze solid and fell to the ground. The descendants of that bul-gae forever hone their powers of flame and ice so that they may one day succeed where their ancestor failed. **[Recall Knowledge - Beast](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=2), [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10)): DC 34 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 32 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 29 [Bul-Gae](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1411) **Source** [Pathfinder #168: King of the Mountain](/Sources.aspx?ID=87) pg. 79 **Perception** +26; [greater darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12), [scent](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=33) (imprecise) 60 feet **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1) **Skills** [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +28, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +23, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +23, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=16) +25 **Str** +8 **Dex** +4 **Con** +7 **Int** +5 **Wis** +6 **Cha** +4 --- **AC** 33 **Fort** +28 **Ref** +22 **Will** +25 **HP** 255 **Resistances** cold 15, fire 15 **Eclipse Aura** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=206), [darkness](/Traits.aspx?ID=39), [occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=120)) 100 feet. Light and shadows morph strangely around the bul-gae. A creature attempting to create a [light](/Traits.aspx?ID=100) effect within the aura must attempt a DC 5 flat check. On a failure, the attempt fails, the effect is lost, and the DC to [counteract](/Rules.aspx?ID=371) [darkness](/Traits.aspx?ID=39) effects within the aura is increased by 1.
**Solar Flare** ([evocation](/Traits.aspx?ID=65), [fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=72), [occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=120)) **Trigger** The bul-gae takes damage; **Effect** The bul-gae releases a solar flare in a 30-foot emanation. Each creature in the area takes 6d8 fire damage (DC 34 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save). On a critical failure, a creature also takes 2d10 [persistent fire damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29). After using this ability, the bul-gae's flames cool and they can't use Solar Flare again until after they have used Lunar Burst. --- **Speed** 40 feet **Melee** jaws +27 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170)), **Damage** 2d8+12 piercing plus 2d6 cold or fire and [Knockdown](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=20) **Lunar Burst** ([Cold](/Traits.aspx?ID=27), [Evocation](/Traits.aspx?ID=65), [Occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=120)) The bul-gae releases a blast of otherworldly frost that deals 6d8 cold damage to each creature in a 10-foot emanation (DC 34 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save). On a critical failure, a creature also becomes [slowed 2](/Conditions.aspx?ID=35). After using this ability, the bul-gae's flames heat up and they can't use Lunar Burst again until after they have used Solar Flare. **Shadow Leap** ([Conjuration](/Traits.aspx?ID=33), [Occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=120), [Shadow](/Traits.aspx?ID=143), [Teleportation](/Traits.aspx?ID=156)) **Requirement** The bul-gae is in dim light or darkness; **Effect** The bul-gae dives into a shadow and reappears from a shadow within 40 feet. **Thermal Mastery** The bul-gae has total control over the powers of cold and fire. Each time it attacks with its jaws, it can choose to have the additional damage be either cold damage or fire damage.
Eclipsed Light Bul-gae bring with them the distorted light of an eclipse wherever they go. This distorted light favors blue hues and skews the spectrum of visible colors, giving the world an eerie, muted ambiance. Tales say that bul-gae serve as faithful companions to the ancient, shadowy master of the first bul-gae. These tales purport that the shadow master can see through the distorted light of all bul-gae and uses the hounds as a means to watch the [Material Plane](/Planes.aspx?ID=1) for unknown purposes.
